projectPurpose: To provide a modern, high-performance, feature-rich, and highly customizable cross-platform terminal emulator with integrated multiplexing capabilities.
mainFeatures: Built-in terminal multiplexer (panes, tabs, windows) on local and remote hosts
Ligatures, Color Emoji, and font fallback
True color and dynamic color schemes

alternatives.name: Alacritty
mainFeatures: Vi mode for navigation and selection

alternatives.name: Kitty
mainFeatures: Supports modern terminal features (ligatures, true color, images)

alternatives.name: iTerm2
mainFeatures: Advanced copy and paste, paste history

alternatives.name: Windows Terminal
mainFeatures: Support for various shells (CMD, PS, WSL)

alternatives.name: tmux
mainFeatures: Copy and paste with multiple buffers

marketPositioning: Wezterm positions itself as a modern, high-performance, cross-platform terminal emulator that integrates terminal multiplexing directly, differentiating it from traditional setups relying on separate tools like tmux or screen. By leveraging GPU acceleration and being built in Rust, it aims to provide a fast and smooth experience. Its extensive customization via Lua scripting appeals to power users seeking fine-grained control. While competing with other GPU-accelerated cross-platform emulators like Alacritty and Kitty, Wezterm's built-in multiplexer is a key feature. It competes with platform-specific leaders like iTerm2 (macOS) and Windows Terminal by offering broader OS support while aiming for a comparable or enhanced feature set, particularly in its integrated multiplexing and scripting capabilities. It targets users who desire a single, highly customizable, performant, and consistent terminal experience across diverse computing environments.
